org.pikater.core.utilities.evolution

Class Population

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.core.utilities.evolution.Population
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Population
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A container which contains the individuals of a population.
    Author:
    Martin Pilat

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Population()
      Creates a new empty population.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Population

        public Population()
        Creates a new empty population.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Makes a deep copy of the population.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A deep copy of the population. All individuals are cloned using their clone methods.

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Shuffles the order of the individuals in the population randomly.

      • setSampleIndividual

        public void setSampleIndividual(Individual sample)
        Sets the individual which is cloned to create the random initial population.
        Parameters:
        sample - The sample individual.

      • setPopulationSize

        public void setPopulationSize(int size)
        Sets the population size, used only during the random initialization.
        Parameters:
        size - The population size.

      • getPopulationSize

        public int getPopulationSize()
        Returns the actual size of the population.
        Returns:
        The number of individuals in the population.

      • get

        public Individual get(int i)
        Gets the ith individual in the population.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the individual which shall be returned.
        Returns:
        The indivudal at index i.

      • add

        public void add(Individual ind)
        Adds an individual to the population.
        Parameters:
        ind - The individual which shall be addded.

      • addAll

        public void addAll(Population p)
        Adds all the individuals fromt he population p to the population. Does not clone them.
        Parameters:
        p - The population from which the individuals shall be added.

      • createRandomInitialPopulation

        public void createRandomInitialPopulation()
        Creates random initial population of the specified size. Calls the clone method on the sample individual and the randomInitialization method on the clones created from it.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all the individuals from the population.

      • getSortedIndividuals

        public java.util.ArrayList<Individual> getSortedIndividuals()
        Returns all the individuals in the population as a list sorted in descending order og their fitness.
        Returns:
        The sorted list of individuals.
